Introduction

The main purpose of this paper is studying of the properties of pluricanonical systems on surfaces with K2â¤4superscriptð¾24K^{2}\leq 4.

The first part is devoted to the study of the spannedness of bicanonical systems on surfaces of general type with small K2superscriptð¾2K^{2} or, which is the same, on canonical models of such surfaces.

The study of the bicanonical system on a canonical surface has two advantages. Namely, it is well known that linear systems tend to have less singular points as base points (e.g., see Theorem 1.1). The second advantage is that studying of an ample line bundle is easier than that of a nef one.

The main result of this part is the following

Theorem 0.1

Let XðX be a canonical surface with KX2=4superscriptsubscriptð¾ð24K_{X}^{2}=4. Then |2âKX|2subscriptð¾ð|2K_{X}| has no fixed part and every base point of XðX is smooth. In particular, the bicanonical system on the minimal model of XðX has no base component.

A well-known theorem says that |2âKX|2subscriptð¾ð|2K_{X}| is base point free if KX2>4superscriptsubscriptð¾ð24K_{X}^{2}>4 or pgâ(X)>0subscriptððð0p_{g}(X)>0 but our knowledge of base points, or even base components, in the case when 2â¤KX2â¤42superscriptsubscriptð¾ð242\leq K_{X}^{2}\leq 4 and pg=0subscriptðð0p_{g}=0 is very limited (see e.g.Â [CT] and [We]).

To prove Theorem 0.1 we use our earlier work on adjoint linear series ([La1] and [La2]) generalizing Reiderâs criterion to normal surfaces to exclude singular base points and all but one possibility for the fixed component and then we use the bilinear map lemma and Cliffordâs theorem for arbitrary CohenâMacaulay curves (see Section 2) to exclude the remaining case.

In the second part of the paper we describe which degree 222 clusters are contracted by Ï4âKXsubscriptð4subscriptð¾ð\varphi_{4K_{X}} on a numerical Godeaux surface and by Ï3âKXsubscriptð3subscriptð¾ð\varphi_{3K_{X}} on a Campedelli surface. Here we have the following theorems (looking at them one should remember that the torsion group Torsâ¡XTorsð{\operatorname{Tors}}X is finite; see 1.6):

Theorem 0.2

Let XðX be a canonical numerical Godeaux surface. If |4âKX|4subscriptð¾ð|4K_{X}| contracts a degree 222 cluster Î¶ð\zeta, then Î¶ð\zeta is contained in a curve Dâ|KX+Ï|ð·subscriptð¾ððD\in|K_{X}+\tau|, where 0â ÏâTorsâ¡X0ðTorsð0\neq\tau\in{\operatorname{Tors}}X and the morphism Ï4âKXsubscriptð4subscriptð¾ð\varphi_{4K_{X}} restricted to Dð·D is either:

1.âan embedding apart from the contracted cluster Î¶ð\zeta if 2âÏâ 02ð02\tau\neq 0 in Torsâ¡XTorsð{\operatorname{Tors}}X,or

2.âa double covering of â1superscriptâ1{\mathbb{P}}^{1}, if 2âÏ=02ð02\tau=0 in Torsâ¡XTorsð{\operatorname{Tors}}X.

Theorem 0.3

Let XðX be a canonical model of a numerical Campedelli surface. If a degree 222 cluster Î¶ð\zeta is contracted by |3âKX|3subscriptð¾ð|3K_{X}|, then one of the following holds:

1.âThere exists an honestly hyperelliptic curve Câ|2âKX|ð¶2subscriptð¾ðC\in|2K_{X}| containing Î¶ð\zeta and Ï3âKX|Cevaluated-atsubscriptð3subscriptð¾ðð¶\varphi_{3K_{X}}|_{C} is a double covering of â1superscriptâ1{\mathbb{P}}^{1}.

2.âÎ¶ð\zeta is a scheme-theoretic intersection of two curves B1â|KX+Ï|subscriptðµ1subscriptð¾ððB_{1}\in|K_{X}+\tau| and B2â|KXâÏ|subscriptðµ2subscriptð¾ððB_{2}\in|K_{X}-\tau|, for some ÏâTorsâ¡XðTorsð\tau\in{\operatorname{Tors}}X such that 2âÏâ 02ð02\tau\neq 0.

After writing down this paper (apart from the part after Lemma 5.4, which was inspired by the paper of Kotschick) we learnt about a related paper of Kotschick [Ko], who however considered mainly the case of torsion free numerically Godeaux or Campedelli surfaces. Our Theorems 0.2 and 0.3 (together with Proposition 5.5 giving a topological interpretation of curves appearing in case 1 of Theorem 0.3) generalize Theorems 1 and 2, [ibid].

He also proved ([Theorem 3, ibid]) a criterion for spannedness of |2âKX|2subscriptð¾ð|2K_{X}| in terms of the fundamental group of XðX and the second Stifel-Whitney class of the tangent bundle of XðX. Since even the fundamental group is known only in explicit examples and can vary (and for some examples it is not finite), the criterion seems to be only of theoretical interest.

Corollary 1.2

Let xð¥x be a singular point of the canonical surface XðX. Then |2âKX|2subscriptð¾ð|2K_{X}| is globally generated at xð¥x unless

We will usually apply Cliffordâs lemma for rank one torsion-free sheaves on a reduced, irreducible curve.

Remarks.

(1) Combining Proposition 5.2 and Theorem 0.3 we see that there is only a finite number of degree 222 clusters which are contracted by |3âKX|3subscriptð¾ð|3K_{X}| and are not contained in curves from 1 in Theorem 0.3.
